The record is active in the system

row.value: The record is active in the system

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

Document sequence number of the document

row.value: Document sequence number of the document

value.original:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

Credit Management is inactive if Credit Status is No Credit Check, Credit Stop or if the Credit Limit is 0. If active, the status is set automatically set to Credit Hold, if the Total Open Balance (including Vendor activities) is higher then the Credit Limit. It is set to Credit Watch, if above 90% of the Credit Limit and Credit OK otherwise.

The Credit Limit indicates the total amount allowed 'on account' in primary accounting currency. If the Credit Limit is 0, no ckeck is performed. Credit Management is based on the Total Open Amount, which includes Vendor activities.

The Credit Used indicates the total amount of open or unpaid invoices in primary accounting currency for the Business Partner. Credit Management is based on the Total Open Amount, which includes Vendor activities.

The product is excluded from generating Shipments. This allows manual creation of shipments for high demand items. If selected, you need to create the shipment manually. But, the item is always included, when the delivery rule of the Order is Force (e.g. for POS). This allows finer granularity of the Delivery Rule Manual.

The type of product also determines accounting consequences.

The Mail Template indicates the mail template for return messages. Mail text can include variables. The priority of parsing is User/Contact, Business Partner and then the underlying business object (like Request, Dunning, Workflow object).
So, @Name@ would resolve into the User name (if user is defined defined), then Business Partner name (if business partner is defined) and then the Name of the business object if it has a Name.
For Multi-Lingual systems, the template is translated based on the Business Partner's language selection.
The SKU indicates a user defined stock keeping unit. It may be used for an additional bar code symbols or your own schema.
The Sales Representative indicates the Sales Rep for this Region. Any Sales Rep must be a valid internal user.

The Shelf Width indicates the width dimension required on a shelf for a product

The record is active in the system

row.value: The record is active in the system

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

row.value: Document sequence number of the document

value.original:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

Credit Management is inactive if Credit Status is No Credit Check, Credit Stop or if the Credit Limit is 0. If active, the status is set automatically set to Credit Hold, if the Total Open Balance (including Vendor activities) is higher then the Credit Limit. It is set to Credit Watch, if above 90% of the Credit Limit and Credit OK otherwise.

The Credit Limit indicates the total amount allowed 'on account' in primary accounting currency. If the Credit Limit is 0, no ckeck is performed. Credit Management is based on the Total Open Amount, which includes Vendor activities.

The Credit Used indicates the total amount of open or unpaid invoices in primary accounting currency for the Business Partner. Credit Management is based on the Total Open Amount, which includes Vendor activities.

When an order is closed and there is a difference between the ordered quantity and the delivered (invoiced) quantity is the Lost Sales Quantity. Note that the Lost Sales Quantity is 0 if you void an order, so close the order if you want to track lost opportunities. [Void = data entry error - Close = the order is finished]

The Reserved Quantity indicates the quantity of a product that is currently reserved.

The amount for revenue recognition calculation. If empty, the complete invoice amount is used. The difference between Revenue Recognition Amount and Invoice Line Net Amount is immediately recognized as revenue.
The date the revenue reconition starts.
Reference of the Sales Order Line to the corresponding Purchase Order Line or vice versa.

The user defined element displays the optional elements that have been defined for this account combination.

The Order is a control document. The Order is complete when the quantity ordered is the same as the quantity shipped and invoiced. When you cloase an order, unshipped (backordered) quantities are cancelled.
The Charge indicates a type of Charge (Handling, Shipping, Restocking)
The Invoice Rule defines how a Business Partner is invoiced and the frequency of invoicing.
The Freight Amount indicates the amount charged for Freight in the document currency.
How the order will be delivered

row.value: How the order will be delivered

value.original: The Delivery Via indicates how the products should be delivered. For example, will the order be picked up or shipped.
Indicates if this document requires approval

row.value: Indicates if this document requires approval

value.original: The Approved checkbox indicates if this document requires approval before it can be processed.
Credit Approved indicates if the credit approval was successful for Orders
The Warehouse identifies a unique Warehouse where products are stored or Services are provided.
The record is active in the system

row.value: The record is active in the system

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
The Accounting Date indicates the date to be used on the General Ledger account entries generated from this document. It is also used for any currency conversion.
The Sales Representative indicates the Sales Rep for this Region. Any Sales Rep must be a valid internal user.
The Created field indicates the date that this record was created.
The Campaign defines a unique marketing program. Projects can be associated with a pre defined Marketing Campaign. You can then report based on a specific Campaign.
Payment Terms identify the method and timing of payment.
Target document type for conversing documents

row.value: Target document type for conversing documents

value.original: You can convert document types (e.g. from Offer to Order or Invoice). The conversion is then reflected in the current type. This processing is initiated by selecting the appropriate Document Action.
Indicates the Currency to be used when processing or reporting on this record
The Total amount displays the total of all lines in document currency
The Grand Total displays the total amount including Tax and Freight in document currency

value.original: You find the current status in the Document Status field. The options are listed in a popup
The Document Type determines document sequence and processing rules

row.value: The current status of the document

value.original: The Document Status indicates the status of a document at this time. If you want to change the document status, use the Document Action field
An organization is a unit of your client or legal entity - examples are store, department. You can share data between organizations.
Document sequence number of the document

row.value: Document sequence number of the document

value.original:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
Indicates if this document / line is printed

value.original: Indicates the extended line amount based on the quantity and the actual price. Any additional charges or freight are not included. The Amount may or may not include tax. If the price list is inclusive tax, the line amount is the same as the line total.

The record is active in the system

row.value: The record is active in the system

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

value.original: The Document Status indicates the status of a document at this time. If you want to change the document status, use the Document Action field
Document sequence number of the document

row.value: Document sequence number of the document

value.original:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

The Yield is the percentage of a lot that is expected to be of acceptable wuality may fall below 100 percent

row.value: The Yield is the percentage of a lot that is expected to be of acceptable wuality may fall below 100 percent

value.original:
ADempiere Calculate the total yield for a product from the yield for each activity when the process Workflow Cost Roll-Up is executed.
The expected yield for an Activity can be expressed as:
Yield = Acceptable Units at Activity End x 100
The Total manufacturing yield for a product is determined by multiplying the yied percentage for each activity.
Manufacturing Yield = Yield % for Activity 10 x Yied % for Activity 20 , etc
Take care when setting yield to anything but 100% particularly when yied is used for multiples activities

If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
The Bill of Materials check box indicates if this product consists of a bill of materials.
Indicates if this product is part of the master production schedule

row.value: Indicates if this product is part of the master production schedule

value.original:
The independent demand products such as end products or spare parts, should be part of the MPS.

This flag is used to segregate the products to be used in reports and inquiries of the MPS and allows to calculate the MPS by the execution of a selective MRP process.
The Purchased check box indicates if this product is purchased by this organization.

If the DRP Required checkbox is ticked, this means it has been a change in some element which affect the material plan for this product, i.e Network Distribution, Orders, Inventory, MPS, etc. and therefore you need to executed again DRP to adjust the Planned Orders to the new conditions and to get the updated action messages.

If the MRP Required checkbox is ticked, this means it has been a change in some element which affect the material plan for this product, i.e BOM, Orders, Inventory, MPS, etc. and therefore you need to executed again MRP to adjust the Planned Orders to the new conditions and to get the updated action messages.
The Sold check box indicates if this product is sold by this organization.
Identifies the category which this product belongs to. Product categories are used for pricing and selection.
Identifies an item which is either purchased or sold in this organization.
The Warehouse identifies a unique Warehouse where products are stored or Services are provided.

The record is active in the system

row.value: The record is active in the system

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

Credit Management is inactive if Credit Status is No Credit Check, Credit Stop or if the Credit Limit is 0. If active, the status is set automatically set to Credit Hold, if the Total Open Balance (including Vendor activities) is higher then the Credit Limit. It is set to Credit Watch, if above 90% of the Credit Limit and Credit OK otherwise.

The Credit Limit indicates the total amount allowed "on account" in primary accounting currency. If the Credit Limit is 0, no check is performed. Credit Management is based on the Total Open Amount, which includes Vendor activities.

The Credit Used indicates the total amount of open or unpaid invoices in primary accounting currency for the Business Partner. Credit Management is based on the Total Open Amount, which includes Vendor activities.

value.original:
ADempiere Calculate the total yield for a product from the yield for each activity when the process Workflow Cost Roll-Up is executed.
The expected yield for an Activity can be expressed as:
Yield = Acceptable Units at Activity End x 100
The Total manufacturing yield for a product is determined by multiplying the yied percentage for each activity.
Manufacturing Yield = Yield % for Activity 10 x Yied % for Activity 20 , etc
Take care when setting yield to anything but 100% particularly when yied is used for multiples activities

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

Document sequence number of the document

row.value: Document sequence number of the document

value.original:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

The product is excluded from generating Shipments. This allows manual creation of shipments for high demand items. If selected, you need to create the shipment manually. But, the item is always included, when the delivery rule of the Order is Force (e.g. for POS). This allows finer granularity of the Delivery Rule Manual.

The Mail Template indicates the mail template for return messages. Mail text can include variables. The priority of parsing is User/Contact, Business Partner and then the underlying business object (like Request, Dunning, Workflow object).
So, @Name@ would resolve into the User name (if user is defined defined), then Business Partner name (if business partner is defined) and then the Name of the business object if it has a Name.
For Multi-Lingual systems, the template is translated based on the Business Partner's language selection.

When an order is closed and there is a difference between the ordered quantity and the delivered (invoiced) quantity is the Lost Sales Quantity. Note that the Lost Sales Quantity is 0 if you void an order, so close the order if you want to track lost opportunities. [Void = data entry error - Close = the order is finished]

Document sequence number of the document

row.value: Document sequence number of the document

value.original:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

The record is active in the system

row.value: The record is active in the system

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
The Bill of Materials check box indicates if this product consists of a bill of materials.
Drop Shipments are sent from the Vendor directly to the Customer

row.value: Drop Shipments are sent from the Vendor directly to the Customer

value.original: Drop Shipments do not cause any Inventory reservations or movements as the Shipment is from the Vendor's inventory. The Shipment of the Vendor to the Customer must be confirmed.

The product is excluded from generating Shipments. This allows manual creation of shipments for high demand items. If selected, you need to create the shipment manually. But, the item is always included, when the delivery rule of the Order is Force (e.g. for POS). This allows finer granularity of the Delivery Rule Manual.
Print detail BOM elements on the invoice

row.value: Print detail BOM elements on the invoice

value.original: The Print Details on Invoice indicates that the BOM element products will print on the Invoice as opposed to this product.
Phantom Component are not stored and produced with the product. This is an option to avild maintaining an Engineering and Manufacturing Bill of Materials.
Print detail records on pick list

row.value: Print detail records on pick list

value.original: Print detail BOM elements on the pick list

row.value: Print detail BOM elements on the pick list

value.original: The Print Details on Pick List indicates that the BOM element products will print on the Pick List as opposed to this product.
The Purchased check box indicates if this product is purchased by this organization.
This is a Self-Service entry or this entry can be changed via Self-Service

row.value: This is a Self-Service entry or this entry can be changed via Self-Service

value.original: Self-Service allows users to enter data or update their data. The flag indicates, that this record was entered or created via Self-Service or that the user can change it via the Self-Service functionality.
The Sold check box indicates if this product is sold by this organization.
The Stocked check box indicates if this product is stocked by this Organization.
A summary entity represents a branch in a tree rather than an end-node. Summary entities are used for reporting and do not have own values.
The BOM configuration has been verified

row.value: The BOM configuration has been verified

value.original: The Verified check box indicates if the configuration of this product has been verified. This is used for products that consist of a bill of materials
If selected, the product is displayed in the initial or any empty search

row.value: If selected, the product is displayed in the initial or any empty search

value.original: In the display of products in the Web Store, the product is displayed in the initial view or if no search criteria are entered. To be displayed, the product must be in the price list used.
The Low Level is used to calculate the material plan and determines if a net requirement should be exploited

row.value: The Low Level is used to calculate the material plan and determines if a net requirement should be exploited

value.original: The values of the actual Product Attribute Instances. The product level attributes are defined on Product level.
Define Product Attribute Sets to add additional attributes and values to the product. You need to define a Attribute Set if you want to enable Serial and Lot Number tracking.
Freight Categories are used to calculate the Freight for the Shipper selected
The Locator indicates where in a Warehouse a product is located.
Identifies the category which this product belongs to. Product categories are used for pricing and selection.
Identifies the Class which this product belongs to
Identifies the classification which this product belongs to.
Identifies the Group which this product belongs to.
Identifies an item which is either purchased or sold in this organization.
The name of an entity (record) is used as an default search option in addition to the search key. The name is up to 60 characters in length.
The type of product also determines accounting consequences.

The Mail Template indicates the mail template for return messages. Mail text can include variables. The priority of parsing is User/Contact, Business Partner and then the underlying business object (like Request, Dunning, Workflow object).
So, @Name@ would resolve into the User name (if user is defined defined), then Business Partner name (if business partner is defined) and then the Name of the business object if it has a Name.
For Multi-Lingual systems, the template is translated based on the Business Partner's language selection.
The SKU indicates a user defined stock keeping unit. It may be used for an additional bar code symbols or your own schema.
The Sales Representative indicates the Sales Rep for this Region. Any Sales Rep must be a valid internal user.
The Shelf Depth indicates the depth dimension required on a shelf for a product
The Shelf Height indicates the height dimension required on a shelf for a product
The Shelf Width indicates the width dimension required on a shelf for a product
Bar Code (Universal Product Code or its superset European Article Number)

row.value: Bar Code (Universal Product Code or its superset European Article Number)

value.original: Use this field to enter the bar code for the product in any of the bar code symbologies (Codabar, Code 25, Code 39, Code 93, Code 128, UPC (A), UPC (E), EAN-13, EAN-8, ITF, ITF-14, ISBN, ISSN, JAN-13, JAN-8, POSTNET and FIM, MSI/Plessey, and Pharmacode)
The Units Per Pack indicates the no of units of a product packed together.

row.value: The Units Per Pack indicates the no of units of a product packed together.

value.original: The Units per Pallet indicates the number of units of this product which fit on a pallet.
The Updated field indicates the date that this record was updated.
The Updated By field indicates the user who updated this record.
Search key for the record in the format required - must be unique

row.value: Search key for the record in the format required - must be unique

value.original: A search key allows you a fast method of finding a particular record. If you leave the search key empty, the system automatically creates a numeric number. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
The Volume indicates the volume of the product in the Volume UOM of the Client
The Weight indicates the weight of the product in the Weight UOM of the Client
The Validation Code displays the date, time and message of the error.

The Created By field indicates the user who created this record.

URL of image; The image is not stored in the database, but retrieved at runtime. The image can be a gif, jpeg or png.

Total Open Balance Amount in primary Accounting Currency

row.value: Total Open Balance Amount in primary Accounting Currency

value.original: The Total Open Balance Amount is the calculated open item amount for Customer and Vendor activity. If the Balance is below zero, we owe the Business Partner. The amount is used for Credit Management. Invoices and Payment Allocations determine the Open Balance (i.e. not Orders or Payments).
Business partner is exempt from tax on purchases

row.value: Business partner is exempt from tax on purchases

value.original: If a business partner is exempt from tax on purchases, the exempt tax rate is used. For this, you need to set up a tax rate with a 0% rate and indicate that this is your tax exempt rate. This is required for tax reporting, so that you can track tax exempt transactions.

Credit Management is inactive if Credit Status is No Credit Check, Credit Stop or if the Credit Limit is 0. If active, the status is set automatically set to Credit Hold, if the Total Open Balance (including Vendor activities) is higher then the Credit Limit. It is set to Credit Watch, if above 90% of the Credit Limit and Credit OK otherwise.

The Business Partner is another Organization for explicit Inter-Org transactions

row.value: The Business Partner is another Organization for explicit Inter-Org transactions

value.original: The business partner is another organization in the system. So when performing transactions, the counter-document is created automatically. Example: You have BPartnerA linked to OrgA and BPartnerB linked to OrgB. If you create a sales order for BPartnerB in OrgA a purchase order is created for BPartnerA in OrgB. This allows to have explicit documents for Inter-Org transactions.

Document sequence number of the document

row.value: Document sequence number of the document

value.original:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
The Accounting Date indicates the date to be used on the General Ledger account entries generated from this document. It is also used for any currency conversion.

The record is active in the system

row.value: The record is active in the system

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

Document sequence number of the document

row.value: Document sequence number of the document

value.original:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

Where inventory should be picked from first

row.value: Where inventory should be picked from first

value.original: The Relative Priority indicates the location to pick from first if an product is stored in more than one location. (100 = highest priority, 0 = lowest). For outgoing shipments, the location is picked with the highest priority where the entire quantity can be shipped from. If there is no location, the location with the highest priority is used. The Priority is ignored for products with Guarantee Date (always the oldest first) or if a specific instance is selected. Incoming receipts are stored at the location with the highest priority, if not explicitly selected.

The product is excluded from generating Shipments. This allows manual creation of shipments for high demand items. If selected, you need to create the shipment manually. But, the item is always included, when the delivery rule of the Order is Force (e.g. for POS). This allows finer granularity of the Delivery Rule Manual.

The Mail Template indicates the mail template for return messages. Mail text can include variables. The priority of parsing is User/Contact, Business Partner and then the underlying business object (like Request, Dunning, Workflow object).
So, @Name@ would resolve into the User name (if user is defined defined), then Business Partner name (if business partner is defined) and then the Name of the business object if it has a Name.
For Multi-Lingual systems, the template is translated based on the Business Partner's language selection.

value.original: The current status of the document

row.value: The current status of the document

value.original: The Document Status indicates the status of a document at this time. If you want to change the document status, use the Document Action field
Document sequence number of the document

row.value: Document sequence number of the document

value.original:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
The record is active in the system

row.value: The record is active in the system

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.
The Bill of Materials check box indicates if this product consists of a bill of materials.
Indicates if this product is part of the master production schedule

row.value: Indicates if this product is part of the master production schedule

value.original:
The independent demand products such as end products or spare parts, should be part of the MPS.

This flag is used to segregate the products to be used in reports and inquiries of the MPS and allows to calculate the MPS by the execution of a selective MRP process.
The Purchased check box indicates if this product is purchased by this organization.

If the DRP Required checkbox is ticked, this means it has been a change in some element which affect the material plan for this product, i.e Network Distribution, Orders, Inventory, MPS, etc. and therefore you need to executed again DRP to adjust the Planned Orders to the new conditions and to get the updated action messages.

If the MRP Required checkbox is ticked, this means it has been a change in some element which affect the material plan for this product, i.e BOM, Orders, Inventory, MPS, etc. and therefore you need to executed again MRP to adjust the Planned Orders to the new conditions and to get the updated action messages.
The Sold check box indicates if this product is sold by this organization.
The values of the actual Product Attribute Instances. The product level attributes are defined on Product level.
Identifies the category which this product belongs to. Product categories are used for pricing and selection.
Identifies an item which is either purchased or sold in this organization.

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. Credit Management is inactive if Credit Status is No Credit Check, Credit Stop or if the Credit Limit is 0. If active, the status is set automatically set to Credit Hold, if the Total Open Balance (including Vendor activities) is higher then the Credit Limit. It is set to Credit Watch, if above 90% of the Credit Limit and Credit OK otherwise.

Minimum Shelf Life in percent based on Product Instance Guarantee Date

row.value: Minimum Shelf Life in percent based on Product Instance Guarantee Date

value.original: Minimum Shelf Life of products with Guarantee Date instance. If > 0 you cannot select products with a shelf life ((Guarantee Date-Today) / Guarantee Days) less than the minimum shelf life, unless you select "Show All"
The Business Partner is another Organization for explicit Inter-Org transactions

row.value: The Business Partner is another Organization for explicit Inter-Org transactions

value.original: The business partner is another organization in the system. So when performing transactions, the counter-document is created automatically. Example: You have BPartnerA linked to OrgA and BPartnerB linked to OrgB. If you create a sales order for BPartnerB in OrgA a purchase order is created for BPartnerA in OrgB. This allows to have explicit documents for Inter-Org transactions.
Total Open Balance Amount in primary Accounting Currency

row.value: Total Open Balance Amount in primary Accounting Currency

value.original: The Total Open Balance Amount is the calculated open item amount for Customer and Vendor activity. If the Balance is below zero, we owe the Business Partner. The amount is used for Credit Management. Invoices and Payment Allocations determine the Open Balance (i.e. not Orders or Payments).

The Mail Template indicates the mail template for return messages. Mail text can include variables. The priority of parsing is User/Contact, Business Partner and then the underlying business object (like Request, Dunning, Workflow object).
So, @Name@ would resolve into the User name (if user is defined defined), then Business Partner name (if business partner is defined) and then the Name of the business object if it has a Name.
For Multi-Lingual systems, the template is translated based on the Business Partner's language selection.
Drop Shipments are sent from the Vendor directly to the Customer

row.value: Drop Shipments are sent from the Vendor directly to the Customer

value.original: Drop Shipments do not cause any Inventory reservations or movements as the Shipment is from the Vendor's inventory. The Shipment of the Vendor to the Customer must be confirmed.

The product is excluded from generating Shipments. This allows manual creation of shipments for high demand items. If selected, you need to create the shipment manually. But, the item is always included, when the delivery rule of the Order is Force (e.g. for POS). This allows finer granularity of the Delivery Rule Manual.

The record is active in the system

row.value: The record is active in the system

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

The defaults are evaluated in the order of definition, the first not null value becomes the default value of the column. The values are separated by comma or semicolon. a) Literals:. 'Text' or 123 b) Variables - in format @Variable@ - Login e.g. #Date, #AD_Org_ID, #AD_Client_ID - Accounting Schema: e.g. $C_AcctSchema_ID, $C_Calendar_ID - Global defaults: e.g. DateFormat - Window values (all Picks, CheckBoxes, RadioButtons, and DateDoc/DateAcct) c) SQL code with the tag: @SQL=SELECT something AS DefaultValue FROM ... The SQL statement can contain variables. There can be no other value other than the SQL statement. The default is only evaluated, if no user preference is defined. Default definitions are ignored for record columns as Key, Parent, Client as well as Buttons.

The defaults are evaluated in the order of definition, the first not null value becomes the default value of the column. The values are separated by comma or semicolon. a) Literals:. The SQL statement can contain variables. There can be no other value other than the SQL statement. The default is only evaluated, if no user preference is defined. Default definitions are ignored for record columns as Key, Parent, Client as well as Buttons.

Document sequence number of the document

row.value: Document sequence number of the document

value.original:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

The record is active in the system

row.value: The record is active in the system

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

row.value: Document sequence number of the document

value.original:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).
The name of an entity (record) is used as an default search option in addition to the search key. The name is up to 60 characters in length.

Credit Management is inactive if Credit Status is No Credit Check, Credit Stop or if the Credit Limit is 0. If active, the status is set automatically set to Credit Hold, if the Total Open Balance (including Vendor activities) is higher then the Credit Limit. It is set to Credit Watch, if above 90% of the Credit Limit and Credit OK otherwise.

Minimum Shelf Life in percent based on Product Instance Guarantee Date

row.value: Minimum Shelf Life in percent based on Product Instance Guarantee Date

value.original: Minimum Shelf Life of products with Guarantee Date instance. If > 0 you cannot select products with a shelf life ((Guarantee Date-Today) / Guarantee Days) less than the minimum shelf life, unless you select "Show All"
The Business Partner is another Organization for explicit Inter-Org transactions

row.value: The Business Partner is another Organization for explicit Inter-Org transactions

value.original: The business partner is another organization in the system. So when performing transactions, the counter-document is created automatically. Example: You have BPartnerA linked to OrgA and BPartnerB linked to OrgB. If you create a sales order for BPartnerB in OrgA a purchase order is created for BPartnerA in OrgB. This allows to have explicit documents for Inter-Org transactions.
Total Open Balance Amount in primary Accounting Currency

row.value: Total Open Balance Amount in primary Accounting Currency

value.original: The Total Open Balance Amount is the calculated open item amount for Customer and Vendor activity. If the Balance is below zero, we owe the Business Partner. The amount is used for Credit Management. Invoices and Payment Allocations determine the Open Balance (i.e. not Orders or Payments).
Business partner is exempt from tax on purchases

row.value: Business partner is exempt from tax on purchases

value.original: If a business partner is exempt from tax on purchases, the exempt tax rate is used. For this, you need to set up a tax rate with a 0% rate and indicate that this is your tax exempt rate. This is required for tax reporting, so that you can track tax exempt transactions.

value.original: The record is active in the system

row.value: The record is active in the system

value.original: There are two methods of making records unavailable in the system: One is to delete the record, the other is to de-activate the record. A de-activated record is not available for selection, but available for reports. There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

Document sequence number of the document

row.value: Document sequence number of the document

value.original:
The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

Share of Customer's business as a percentage

Business partner is exempt from tax on sales

row.value: Business partner is exempt from tax on sales

value.original: If a business partner is exempt from tax on sales, the exempt tax rate is used. For this, you need to set up a tax rate with a 0% rate and indicate that this is your tax exempt rate. This is required for tax reporting, so that you can track tax exempt transactions.

value.original: The Acquisition Cost identifies the cost associated with making this prospect a customer.

The Dunning indicates the rules and method of dunning for past due payments.

How the order will be delivered

row.value: How the order will be delivered

value.original: The Delivery Via indicates how the products should be delivered. For example, will the order be picked up or shipped.

The Credit Limit indicates the total amount allowed "on account" in primary accounting currency. If the Credit Limit is 0, no check is performed. Credit Management is based on the Total Open Amount, which includes Vendor activities.
Print Discount on Invoice and Order

row.value: Print Discount on Invoice and Order

value.original: The Discount Printed Checkbox indicates if the discount will be printed on the document.
The Greeting identifies the greeting to print on correspondence.
Indicates if the business partner is a sales representative or company agent

row.value: Indicates if the business partner is a sales representative or company agent

value.original: The Sales Rep checkbox indicates if this business partner is a sales representative. A sales representative may also be an employee, but does not need to be.
A summary entity represents a branch in a tree rather than an end-node. Summary entities are used for reporting and do not have own values.
Payment Terms identify the method and timing of payment.
The Payment Rule indicates the method of invoice payment.
You need to define a Print Format to print the document.
Send emails with document attached (e.g. Invoice, Delivery Note, etc.)
The parent (organization) of the Business Partner for reporting purposes.
Schema to calculate the trade discount percentage

row.value: Schema to calculate the trade discount percentage

value.original: After calculation of the (standard) price, the trade discount percentage is calculated and applied resulting in the final price.
The Prospect checkbox indicates an entity that is an active prospect.
Transaction Reference Number (Sales Order, Purchase Order) of your Business Partner

row.value: Transaction Reference Number (Sales Order, Purchase Order) of your Business Partner

value.original: The business partner order reference is the order reference for this specific transaction; Often Purchase Order numbers are given to print on Invoices for easier reference. A standard number can be defined in the Business Partner (Customer) window.
The Sales Representative indicates the Sales Rep for this Region. Any Sales Rep must be a valid internal user.

Credit Management is inactive if Credit Status is No Credit Check, Credit Stop or if the Credit Limit is 0. If active, the status is set automatically set to Credit Hold, if the Total Open Balance (including Vendor activities) is higher then the Credit Limit. It is set to Credit Watch, if above 90% of the Credit Limit and Credit OK otherwise.
Indicates if this Business Partner is a Customer

row.value: Indicates if this Business Partner is a Customer

value.original: The Customer checkbox indicates if this Business Partner is a customer. If it is select additional fields will display which further define this customer.
The Payment Rule indicates the method of purchase payment.
The First Sale Date identifies the date of the first sale to this Business Partner
Minimum Shelf Life in percent based on Product Instance Guarantee Date

row.value: Minimum Shelf Life in percent based on Product Instance Guarantee Date

value.original: Minimum Shelf Life of products with Guarantee Date instance. If > 0 you cannot select products with a shelf life ((Guarantee Date-Today) / Guarantee Days) less than the minimum shelf life, unless you select "Show All"
The Business Partner is another Organization for explicit Inter-Org transactions

row.value: The Business Partner is another Organization for explicit Inter-Org transactions

value.original: The business partner is another organization in the system. So when performing transactions, the counter-document is created automatically. Example: You have BPartnerA linked to OrgA and BPartnerB linked to OrgB. If you create a sales order for BPartnerB in OrgA a purchase order is created for BPartnerA in OrgB. This allows to have explicit documents for Inter-Org transactions.
Total Open Balance Amount in primary Accounting Currency

row.value: Total Open Balance Amount in primary Accounting Currency

value.original: The Total Open Balance Amount is the calculated open item amount for Customer and Vendor activity. If the Balance is below zero, we owe the Business Partner. The amount is used for Credit Management. Invoices and Payment Allocations determine the Open Balance (i.e. not Orders or Payments).

There are two reasons for de-activating and not deleting records: (1) The system requires the record for audit purposes. (2) The record is referenced by other records. E.g., you cannot delete a Business Partner, if there are invoices for this partner record existing. You de-activate the Business Partner and prevent that this record is used for future entries.

When an order is closed and there is a difference between the ordered quantity and the delivered (invoiced) quantity is the Lost Sales Quantity. Note that the Lost Sales Quantity is 0 if you void an order, so close the order if you want to track lost opportunities. [Void = data entry error - Close = the order is finished]

The document number is usually automatically generated by the system and determined by the document type of the document. If the document is not saved, the preliminary number is displayed in "<>".
If the document type of your document has no automatic document sequence defined, the field is empty if you create a new document. This is for documents which usually have an external number (like vendor invoice). If you leave the field empty, the system will generate a document number for you. The document sequence used for this fallback number is defined in the "Maintain Sequence" window with the name "DocumentNo_<TableName>", where TableName is the actual name of the table (e.g. C_Order).

The Document Base Type identifies the base or starting point for a document. Multiple document types may share a single document base type.
Document sequence determines the numbering of documents

row.value: Document sequence determines the numbering of documents

value.original: The Document Sequence indicates the sequencing rule to use for this document type.

The SO Sub Type indicates the type of sales order this document refers to. This field only appears when the Document Base Type is Sales Order. The selection made here will determine which documents will be generated when an order is processed and which documents must be generated manually or in batches.
The following outlines this process.
SO Sub Type of Standard Order will generate just the Order document when the order is processed.
The Delivery Note, Invoice and Receipt must be generated via other processes.
SO Sub Type of Warehouse Order will generate the Order and Delivery Note.
The Invoice and Receipt must be generated via other processes.
SO Sub Type of Credit Order will generate the Order, Delivery Note and Invoice.
The Receipt must be generated via other processes.
SO Sub Type of POS (Point of Sale) will generate all document
